segment.documentation: BGM, A segment to indicate the beginning of the message by identifying the message by a document number.
DTM, A segment to specify the document date.
RFF, A segment to express a reference which relates to the whole message such as, the job number of a related inspection report.
LOC, A segment to indicate the location of the vessel during the inspection.
FTX, A segment to specify free form or supplementary information relevant to the entire message such as a letter of protest.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments to identify the inspection company and any related parties pertaining to the whole message, their contacts and communication channel information. If more than one party is associated with the cargo, they are to be identified at the detail level.

segment.documentation: PNA, A segment to identify the name of the inspection company and any related parties pertaining to the whole message.
ADR, A segment to specify the address of the identified parties.
RFF, A segment to specify reference numbers related to the identified party.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to identify contacts and related communication numbers of the identified parties.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department within a party.
COM, A segment to identify a communication number of a person or department to whom communication should be directed.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to specify a time log, detailing such information as, docked date and time, notice of readiness date and time, and reasons for excess transportation time.

segment.documentation: DTM, A segment providing date and time information related to the voyage.
STS, A segment providing status event details related to the voyage.
FTX, A segment to specify free form or supplementary information pertaining to the status event and time. 4.1.2 Detail section Information to be provided in the Detail section:

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments to identify the cargo and the associated contractual quantity.

segment.documentation: LIN, A segment to identify the cargo.
QTY, A segment to specify the contractual quantity for the identified cargo.
FTX, A segment to specify free form or supplementary information pertaining to the cargo.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments to identify parties, contacts, and communication numbers related to the cargo.

segment.documentation: PNA, A segment to identify the name of parties related to the cargo.
ADR, A segment to specify the address of the identified parties.
RFF, A segment to specify reference numbers related to the identified party.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments to identify contacts and related communication numbers of the identified parties.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department within a party.
COM, A segment to identify a communication number of a person or department to whom communication should be directed.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments to provide details of the transport vessel and the bulk cargo.

segment.documentation: TDT, A segment to specify transport details such as vessel name, voyage number, and carrier as it relates to a stage of transport.
EQD, A segment to specify the type of equipment.
RFF, A segment to specify reference numbers for the lighter vessel identification and its voyage number.
QTY, A segment to specify the quantity of cargo owned by related party.
MEA, A segment to specify measurements related to the vessel such as draft markings.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments to identify test methods and their results related to the cargo.

segment.documentation: PSD, A segment to provide specimen collection details.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments to identify test methods and their results related to the cargo.

segment.documentation: TEM, A segment to identify a test method.
MEA, A segment to specify the results of the test.
DTM, A segment to identify dates and times associated with the test.
FTX, A segment to specify free form or supplementary information pertaining to the test.
